snippet: The explosion came as Sunni and Shiite villagers in northwestern Pakistan were leaving nearby mosques. The police said it killed at least 21 people and wounded 33.
abstract: Explosion in market in northwestern Pakistan kills at least 21 people and wounds 33 in what police described as suicide bombing; Pakistani Taliban claims.

byline.original: By ISMAIL KHAN and SALMAN MASOOD
byline.contributor: Ismail Khan reported from Peshawar, and Salman Masood from Islamabad, Pakistan. Ihsanullah Tipu Mehsud contributed reporting from Islamabad.

lead_paragraph: The explosion came as Sunni and Shiite villagers in northwestern Pakistan were leaving nearby mosques. The police said it killed at least 21 people and wounded 33.

headline.seo: Suicide Bomber Attacks Market in Pakistan
headline.main: Suicide Attack at Market in Northwest Pakistan Kills at Least 21
headline.print_headline: Suicide Attack at Market in Northwest Pakistan Kills at Least 21
